results.name: In base 2: smallest integer which requires n 'Reverse and Add' steps to reach a palindrome.
comment: The analog of A023109 in base 2.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
Index entries for sequences related to Reverse and Add!
example: 11 is the smallest integer which requires two steps to reach a base 2 palindrome (cf. A066057), so a(2) = 11; written in base 10: 11 -> 11 + 13 = 24 -> 24 + 3 = 27; written in base 2: 1011 -> 1011 + 1101 = 11000 -> 11000 + 11 = 11011.
program: (ARIBAS): For function b2reverse see A066057; function a066058(mx: integer); var k,m,n,rev,steps: integer; begin for k := 0 to mx do n := 0; steps := 0; m := n; rev := b2reverse(m); while not(steps = k and m = rev) do inc(n); m := n; rev := b2reverse(m); steps := 0; while steps < k and m <> rev do m := m + rev; rev := b2reverse(m); inc(steps); end; end; write(n,","); end; end; a066058(45).
